intro: Mediocalcar versteegii subsp. versteegii, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of the region. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
